settings.name: access_token
settings.label: Access Token
settings.help:
This is your OAuth access token to connect this domain-server with your Directory Services account.
It can be generated by clicking the 'Connect Account' button above.
You can also go to the Security page of your account on your Directory Server and generate a token with the 'domains' scope and paste it here.

settings.name: id
settings.label: Domain ID
settings.help: This is your Directory Services domain ID. If you do not want your domain to be registered in the Directory Services you can leave this blank.

settings.name: automatic_networking
settings.label: Automatic Networking
settings.help:
This defines how other users will be able to reach your domain-server.
If you don't want to deal with any network settings, use full automatic networking.

options.label: Full: update both the IP address and port to reach my server
IP Only: update just my IP address, I will open the port manually
None: use the network information I have entered for this domain at the Directory Server.

settings.name: local_port
settings.label: Local UDP Port
settings.help:
This is the local port your domain-server binds to for UDP connections.
Depending on your router, this may need to be changed to unique values for each domain-server in order to run multiple full automatic networking domain-servers in the same network. You can use the value 0 to have the domain-server select a random port, which will help in preventing port collisions.

settings.name: enable_packet_verification
settings.label: Enable Packet Verification
settings.help: Enable secure checksums on communication that uses the Directory Services protocol. Increases security with possibly a small performance penalty.

settings.name: enable_metadata_exporter
settings.label: Enable Metadata HTTP Availability
settings.help: Allows your domain's metadata to be accessible on the public internet via direct HTTP connection to the domain server.

settings.name: metadata_exporter_port
settings.label: Metadata Exporter HTTP Port
settings.help: This is the port where the Metadata exporter accepts connections. It listens both on IPv4 and IPv6 and can be accessed remotely, so you should make sure to restrict access with a firewall as needed.

settings.name: enable_crash_reporter
settings.label: Enable Crash Reporter
settings.help: Enable the automatic submission of crash reports to Overte e.V. This will help us find bugs and improve the code. Crash data will only be shared with developers trusted by Overte e.V., and will only be used to aid in development.

settings.name: custom_crash_url
settings.label: Custom crash URL
settings.help: If this is set, it overrides the internal crash reporting URL. This can be used for instance to direct crash reports to Sentry.

settings.name: custom_crash_token
settings.label: Custom crash token
settings.help: This is a token that identifies the thing sending a crash report, such as a product name and version number. If not set, the compile time default will be used.

settings.name: enable_webrtc
settings.label: Enable WebRTC Client Connections
settings.help: Allow web clients to connect over WebRTC data channels.

settings.name: enable_webrtc_websocket_ssl
settings.label: Enable WebRTC WebSocket SSL
settings.help: Use secure WebSocket (wss:// protocol) for WebRTC signaling channel. If "on", the key, cert, and CA files are expected to be in the local Overte app directory, in a /domain-server/ subdirectory with filenames overte-cert.key, overte-cert.crt, and overte-crt-ca.crt.

settings.name: enable_oauth2
settings.label: Enable OAuth2 Authentication
settings.help: Allow a WordPress-based (miniOrange) OAuth2 service to assign users to groups based on their role with the service.

settings.name: oauth2_url_path
settings.label: Authentication URL
settings.help: The URL that the Interface will use to login via OAuth2.

settings.name: wordpress_url_base
settings.label: WordPress API URL Base
settings.help: The URL base that the domain server will use to make WordPress API calls. Typically "https://oursite.com/wp-json/". However, if using non-pretty permalinks or otherwise get a 404 error then try "https://oursite.com/?rest_route=/".

settings.name: plugin_client_id
settings.label: WordPress Plugin Client ID
settings.help: This is the client ID from the WordPress plugin configuration.

settings.name: enable_prometheus_exporter
settings.label: Enable Prometheus Exporter
settings.help: Enable a Prometheus exporter to make it possible to gather stats about the mixers that are available in the Nodes tab with a Prometheus server. This makes it possible to keep track of long-term domain statistics for graphing, troubleshooting, and performance monitoring.

settings.name: prometheus_exporter_port
settings.label: Prometheus TCP Port
settings.help: This is the port where the Prometheus exporter accepts connections. It listens both on IPv4 and IPv6 and can be accessed remotely, so you should make sure to restrict access with a firewall as needed.

settings.name: paths
settings.label: Paths
settings.help:
Clients can enter a path to reach an exact viewpoint in your domain.
Add rows to the table below to map a path to a viewpoint.
The index path ( / ) is where clients will enter if they do not enter an explicit path.

settings.name: descriptors
settings.label: Description
settings.help: This data will be queryable from your server. It may be collected by the Directory Services and used to share your domain with others.

settings.name: world_name
settings.label: Name
settings.help: The name of your domain (256 character limit).

settings.name: description
settings.label: Description
settings.help: A description of your domain (256 character limit).

settings.name: thumbnail
settings.label: World Thumbnail
settings.help: A link to the thumbnail that is publicly accessible from the internet.

settings.name: images
settings.label: World Images
settings.help: URLs to images that visually describe your world to potential visitors.

settings.name: maturity
settings.label: Maturity
settings.help: A maturity rating, available as a guideline for content on your domain.

settings.name: contact_info
settings.label: World Administrative Contact
settings.help: Contact information to reach server administrators for assistance (256 character limit).

settings.name: managers
settings.label: World Managers / Administrators
settings.help: Usernames of managers that administrate the domain.

settings.name: tags
settings.label: Tags
settings.help: Common categories under which your domain falls.

settings.name: http_username
settings.label: HTTP Username
settings.help: Username used for basic HTTP authentication.

settings.name: http_password
settings.label: HTTP Password
settings.help: Password used for basic HTTP authentication. Leave this alone if you do not want to change it.

settings.name: verify_http_password
settings.label: Verify HTTP Password
settings.help: Must match the password entered above for change to be saved.

settings.name: approved_safe_urls
settings.label: Approved Script and QML URLs (Not Enabled)
settings.help: These URLs will be sent to the Interface as safe URLs to allow through the whitelist if the Interface has this security option enabled.

settings.name: maximum_user_capacity
settings.label: Maximum User Capacity
settings.help: The limit on how many users can be connected at once (0 means no limit). Avatars connected from the same machine will not count towards this limit.

settings.name: maximum_user_capacity_redirect_location
settings.label: Redirect to Location on Maximum Capacity
settings.help: The location to redirect users to when the maximum number of avatars are connected.

settings.name: ac_subnet_whitelist
settings.label: Assignment Client IP address Whitelist
settings.help: The IP addresses or subnets of ACs that can connect to this server. You can specify an IP address or a subnet in CIDR notation ('A.B.C.D/E', Example: '10.0.0.0/24'). Local ACs (localhost) are always permitted and do not need to be added here.

settings.name: standard_permissions
settings.label: Domain-Wide User Permissions
settings.help: Indicate which types of users can have which domain-wide permissions.
settings.caption: Standard Permissions

groups.label: Permissions ?

columns.name: id_can_get_and_set_private_user_data
columns.label: Get and Set Private User Data

settings.name: group_permissions
settings.caption: Permissions for Users in Groups
settings.help: For groups that are provided from WordPress you need to denote them by putting an "@" symbol in front of each item, e.g., "@silver".
settings.new_category_message: Save and reload to see ranks

groups.label: Permissions ?

columns.name: id_can_get_and_set_private_user_data
columns.label: Get and Set Private User Data

settings.name: group_forbiddens
settings.caption: Permissions Denied to Users in Groups
settings.help: For groups that are provided from WordPress you need to denote them by putting an "@" symbol in front of each item, e.g., "@silver".
settings.new_category_message: Save and reload to see ranks

groups.label: Permissions ?

columns.name: id_can_get_and_set_private_user_data
columns.label: Get and Set Private User Data

groups.label: Permissions ?

columns.name: id_can_get_and_set_private_user_data
columns.label: Get and Set Private User Data

settings.name: ip_permissions
settings.caption: Permissions for Users from IP Addresses

groups.label: Permissions ?

columns.name: id_can_get_and_set_private_user_data
columns.label: Get and Set Private User Data

settings.name: mac_permissions
settings.caption: Permissions for Users with MAC Addresses

groups.label: Permissions ?

columns.name: id_can_get_and_set_private_user_data
columns.label: Get and Set Private User Data

settings.name: machine_fingerprint_permissions
settings.caption: Permissions for Users with Machine Fingerprints

groups.label: Permissions ?

columns.name: id_can_get_and_set_private_user_data
columns.label: Get and Set Private User Data

settings.name: multi_kick_logged_in
settings.label: Multi-Kick for Logged In Users
settings.help: Kick logged in users by machine fingerprint (in addition to the default kick by username)

settings.name: persistent_scripts
settings.label: Persistent Scripts
settings.help: Add the URLs for scripts that you would like to ensure are always running in your domain.

settings.name: auto_threads
settings.label: Automatically determine thread count
settings.help: Allow system to determine number of threads (recommended)

settings.name: num_threads
settings.label: Number of Threads
settings.help: Threads to spin up for audio mixing (if not automatically set)

settings.name: throttle_start
settings.label: Throttle Start Target
settings.help: Target percentage of frame time to start throttling

settings.name: throttle_backoff
settings.label: Throttle Backoff Target
settings.help: Target percentage of frame time to backoff throttling

settings.name: attenuation_per_doubling_in_distance
settings.label: Default Domain Attenuation
settings.help: Factor between 0 and 1.0 (0: No attenuation, 1.0: extreme attenuation)

settings.name: noise_muting_threshold
settings.label: Noise Muting Threshold
settings.help: Loudness value for noise background between 0 and 1.0 (0: mute everyone, 1.0: never mute). 0.003 is a typical setting to mute loud people.

settings.name: enable_filter
settings.label: Low-pass Filter
settings.help: Positional audio stream uses low-pass filter

settings.name: zones
settings.label: Zones
settings.help: In this table you can define a set of zones in which you can specify various audio properties.

settings.name: attenuation_coefficients
settings.label: Attenuation Coefficients
settings.help: In this table you can set custom attenuation coefficients between audio zones

settings.name: reverb
settings.label: Reverb Settings
settings.help: In this table you can set reverb levels for audio zones.  For a medium-sized (e.g., 100 square meter) meeting room, try a decay time of around 1.5 seconds and a wet/dry mix of 25%. For an airplane hangar or cathedral, try a decay time of 4 seconds and a wet/dry mix of 50%.

settings.name: codec_preference_order
settings.label: Audio Codec Preference Order
settings.help: List of codec names in order of preferred usage

settings.name: codec_settings
settings.label: Audio Codec Settings
settings.help: Advanced settings for audio codecs

settings.name: dynamic_jitter_buffer
settings.label: Dynamic Jitter Buffers
settings.help: Dynamically buffer inbound audio streams based on perceived jitter in packet receipt timing.

settings.name: static_desired_jitter_buffer_frames
settings.label: Static Desired Jitter Buffer Frames
settings.help: If dynamic jitter buffers is disabled, this determines the size of the jitter buffers of inbound audio streams in the mixer. Higher numbers introduce more latency.

settings.name: min_avatar_height
settings.label: Minimum Avatar Height (meters)
settings.help: Limits the height of avatars in your domain. Must be at least 0.009.

settings.name: max_avatar_height
settings.label: Maximum Avatar Height (meters)
settings.help: Limits the height of avatars in your domain. Cannot be greater than 1755.

settings.name: avatar_whitelist
settings.label: Avatars Allowed from:
settings.help: Comma separated list of URLs (with optional paths) that avatar .fst files are allowed from. If someone attempts to use an avatar with a different domain, it will be rejected and the replacement avatar will be used. If left blank, any domain is allowed.

settings.name: replacement_avatar
settings.label: Replacement Avatar for disallowed avatars
settings.help: A URL for an avatar .fst to be used when someone tries to use an avatar that is not allowed. If left blank, the generic default avatar is used.

settings.name: max_node_send_bandwidth
settings.label: Per-Node Bandwidth
settings.help: Desired maximum send bandwidth (in Megabits per second) to each node

settings.name: auto_threads
settings.label: Automatically determine thread count
settings.help: Allow system to determine number of threads (recommended)

settings.name: num_threads
settings.label: Number of Threads
settings.help: Threads to spin up for avatar mixing (if not automatically set)

settings.name: connection_rate
settings.label: Connection Rate
settings.help: Number of new agents that can connect to the mixer every second

settings.name: priority_fraction
settings.label: Hero Bandwidth
settings.help: Fraction of downstream bandwidth reserved for avatars in 'Hero' zones

settings.name: max_node_messages_per_second
settings.label: Maximum Message Rate
settings.help: Maximum message send rate (messages per second) per node

settings.name: maxTmpLifetime
settings.label: Maximum Lifetime of Temporary Entities
settings.help: The maximum number of seconds for the lifetime of an entity which will be considered "temporary".

settings.name: dynamicDomainVerificationTimeMin
settings.label: Dynamic Domain Verification Time (seconds) - Minimum
settings.help: The lower limit on the amount of time that passes before Dynamic Domain Verification on entities occurs. Units are seconds.

settings.name: dynamicDomainVerificationTimeMax
settings.label: Dynamic Domain Verification Time (seconds) - Maximum
settings.help: The upper limit on the amount of time that passes before Dynamic Domain Verification on entities occurs. Units are seconds.

settings.name: entityScriptSourceWhitelist
settings.label: Entity Scripts Allowed from:
settings.help: Comma separated list of URLs (with optional paths) that entity scripts are allowed from. If someone attempts to create and entity or edit an entity to have a different domain, it will be rejected. If left blank, any domain is allowed.

settings.name: entityEditFilter
settings.label: Filter Entity Edits
settings.help: Check all entity edits against this filter function.
settings.placeholder: url whose content is like: function filter(properties) { return properties; }

settings.name: persistFilePath
settings.label: Entities File Path
settings.help:
The path to the file entities are stored in.
If this path is relative it will be relative to the application data directory.
The filename must end in .json.gz.

settings.name: backupDirectoryPath
settings.label: Entities Backup Directory Path
settings.help:
The path to the directory to store backups in.
If this path is relative it will be relative to the application data directory.

settings.name: persistInterval
settings.label: Save Check Interval
settings.help: Milliseconds between checks for saving the current state of entities.

settings.name: NoPersist
settings.label: Disable Persistence
settings.help: Don't persist your entities to a file.

settings.name: NoBackup
settings.label: Disable Backup
settings.help: Don't regularly backup your persisted entities to a backup file.

settings.name: statusHost
settings.label: Status Hostname
settings.help: Host name or IP address of the server for accessing the status page

settings.name: statusPort
settings.label: Status Port
settings.help: Port of the server for accessing the status page

settings.name: persistFileDownload
settings.label: Persist File Download
settings.help: Includes a download link to the persist file in the server status page.

settings.name: wantEditLogging
settings.label: Edit Logging
settings.help: Logging of all edits to entities

settings.name: wantTerseEditLogging
settings.label: Edit Logging (Terse)
settings.help: Logging of all edits to entities

settings.name: verboseDebug
settings.label: Verbose Debug
settings.help: Lots of debugging

settings.name: debugReceiving
settings.label: Extra Receiving Debug
settings.help: Extra debugging on receiving

settings.name: debugSending
settings.label: Extra Sending Debug
settings.help: Extra debugging on sending

settings.name: debugTimestampNow
settings.label: Extra Timestamp Debugging
settings.help: Extra debugging for usecTimestampNow() function

settings.name: clockSkew
settings.label: Clock Skew
settings.help: Number of msecs to skew the server clock by to test clock skew

settings.name: enabled
settings.label: Enabled
settings.help: Assigns an asset-server in your domain to serve files to clients via the ATP protocol (over UDP)

settings.name: assets_path
settings.label: Assets Path
settings.help:
The path to the directory assets are stored in.
If this path is relative, it will be relative to the application data directory.
If you change this path you will need to manually copy any existing assets from the previous directory.

settings.name: assets_filesize_limit
settings.label: File Size Limit
settings.help: The file size limit of an asset that can be imported into the asset server in MBytes. 0 (default) means no limit on file size.

settings.name: entity_pps_per_script
settings.label: Entity PPS per script
settings.help:
The number of packets per second (PPS) that can be sent to the entity server for each server entity script. This contributes to a total overall amount.
Example: 1000 PPS with 5 entites gives a total PPS of 5000 that is shared among the entity scripts. A single could use 4000 PPS, leaving 1000 for the rest, for example.

settings.name: max_total_entity_pps
settings.label: Maximum Total Entity PPS
settings.help:
The maximum total packets per seconds (PPS) that can be sent to the entity server.
Example: 5 scripts @ 1000 PPS per script = 5000 total PPS. A maximum total PPS of 4000 would cap this 5000 total PPS to 4000.

settings.name: users
settings.label: Broadcasted Users
settings.help: Users that are broadcasted to downstream servers

settings.name: downstream_servers
settings.label: Receiving Servers
settings.help: Servers that receive data for broadcasted users

settings.name: upstream_servers
settings.label: Broadcasting Servers
settings.help: Servers that broadcast data to this domain

settings.name: admin-users
settings.label: Admin Users
settings.help: Any of these users can administer the domain.

settings.name: admin-roles
settings.label: Admin Roles
settings.help: Any user with any of these roles can administer the domain.

settings.name: client-id
settings.label: Client ID
settings.help: OAuth client ID.

settings.name: client-secret
settings.label: Client Secret
settings.help: OAuth client secret.

settings.name: provider
settings.label: Provider
settings.help: OAuth provider URL.

settings.name: hostname
settings.label: Hostname
settings.help: OAuth hostname.

settings.name: key-passphrase
settings.label: SSL Private Key Passphrase
settings.help: SSL Private Key Passphrase

settings.name: backup_rules
settings.label: Rolling Backup Rules
settings.help: Define how frequently to create automatic content archives

columns.name: backupInterval
columns.label: Backup Interval in Seconds
columns.help: Interval between backup checks in seconds.

columns.name: maxBackupVersions
columns.label: Max Rolled Backup Versions
columns.help: If your backup extension format uses 'rolling', how many versions do you want us to keep?
